marytts.util.dom
Class DomUtils

java.lang.Object
  marytts.util.dom.DomUtils
Direct Known Subclasses:
MaryDomUtils
public class DomUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of utilities for DOM manipulation or analysis. No object of class DomUtils is created, all methods are static.

Author:
Marc Schröder

                                                                  java.lang.String ancestorName,
                                                                  java.lang.String attributeName)
Search upwards through the ancestors of node with name ancestorName, and return the first ancestor for which an attribute named attributeName is present. Return null if no such ancestor exists.

getAttributeFromClosestAncestorOfAnyKind

public static java.lang.String getAttributeFromClosestAncestorOfAnyKind(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                                        java.lang.String attributeName)
Climb through node's ancestors, looking for one with an attribute named attributeName, irrespective of the respective ancestorName, and return the attribute's value

Parameters:
node -
attributeName -
Returns:
value of attribute from closest ancestor with that attribute, or the empty string if no ancestor has that attribute.

                                                       java.lang.String ancestorName)
If node has ancestors with name ancestorName, return the one closest to the root. If there is no ancestor with that name, return null.

Find the Element with the same tag name as element preceding element within the same subtree under root. Precondition: root must be an ancestor of element.

Returns:
that Element, or null if there is no such Element.

that Element, or null if there is no such Element.

encloseNodesWithNewElement

public static org.w3c.dom.Element encloseNodesWithNewElement(org.w3c.dom.Node first,
                                                             org.w3c.dom.Node last,
                                                             java.lang.String newElementName)
Create a new Element placed in the document tree such that it encloses two existing Nodes. The new element will have the same namespace as the document element.

Algorithm:

  1. Find closest common ancestor a
  2. Identify first (childA) and last (childZ) of a's children that need to be enclosed by the new Element
  3. Insert a new Element node before the first of these children
  4. Move all children between childA and childZ into the new Element.

Returns:
The new element, or null if it could not be created.

NodeListAsList

public static java.util.List NodeListAsList(org.w3c.dom.NodeList nl)

getPlainTextBelow

public static java.lang.String getPlainTextBelow(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
Return the concatenation of the values of all text nodes below the given node. One space character is inserted between adjacent text nodes.

trimAllTextNodes

public static void trimAllTextNodes(org.w3c.dom.Node root)
Go through all text nodes below this node, and replace their text with a trimmed version of their text. This changes the DOM document.

Parameters:
subtree -

areEqual

public static boolean areEqual(org.w3c.dom.Document a,
                               org.w3c.dom.Document b)
Compare two DOM XML documents. This method simply converts both Documents into Strings as with serializeToString(), and compares these Strings.

Parameters:
a -
b -
Returns:
true if equal, false otherwise.
